The Customers screen provides an overview of customers within the specified date range.

This section provides a summary of all customers with transactions during the period shown in the date range.

customers-key-indicators.png
change·remove

Don't have one handy? Use our logo to start!

 
x    
Add Row Add Col
Customers 
The total number of customers based on the selected date range. 
Returning Customers 
The total number of returning customers based on the selected date range. 
Average Spend 
The total revenue less the total refunds and chargebacks, divided by the number of customers based on the selected date range. 
 
This section displays a record for each customer with at least one captured transaction during the specified date range. Each record contains the following: 
Upload an image...
customers-table.png
change·remove

Don't have one handy? Use our logo to start!

 
x    
Add Row Add Col
ID 
The unique ID of the customer. Also called Customer ID. 
Customer Email 
Email address of the customer. 
Order History 
The total number of orders (captured transactions) made by the customer. Refunded transactions do not have an effect on the Order History count. 
LTV 
Lifetime value of the customer. Sum of all captured transactions made by the customer. Refunded transactions do not affect LTV. 
Last Purchase 
 
Last Order Value 
The total value of the most recent order (captured transaction). 
Usual Payment Method 
Payment method most often used by the customer. 
## Search Use the search bar to identify customers based on a specific word, string of words or value. # Filter Use the filter feature to display customers who meet specific criteria. Click the *filter* icon to establish a filter. Note that number to the left of each filter row represents the number of customers matching your filter criteria. 
Select any *Customer ID *to open the Customer Details screen, which displays detailed information about the customer and the customer's transaction history. The buttons on the bottom left corner allow you to *Update Customer Details* (name, email, phone number), *Add a Credit Card* and *Create a Payment* (see below). The screen also lists any cards and local payment methods associated with the customer, which can be edited. 
Upload an image...
customer-view.png
change·remove

Don't have one handy? Use our logo to start!

## Creating a payment Click the *Create Payment* button at the bottom of the Customer Details screen to create a payment using one of the customer's saved cards. Select a saved card from the drop-down menu and fill in the remaining required fields, marked in red. Click More Options to enter additional details such as Billing Address, Shipping Address and customer phone number. To create the payment, press the *Save* button.

The window that follows will display the status of the payment creation. Click *OK* to close.
